                In a joint statement with Sen. John McCain, the South Carolina senator argued that the attack could be undertaken “in a limited way, without boots on the ground.”


 
 | AP Photo

            By 
Gabriel Debenedetti

09/16/15, 07:45 PM EDT
Correct the Record, a super PAC supporting Hillary Clinton, posted a clip of Lindsey Graham appearing to praise Clinton during Wednesday's GOP undercard debate within moments of the South Carolina senator's remark.
"Hillary Clinton has a list a mile long to help the middle class," Graham said, jousting with Rick Santorum over the minimum wage. The clip distributed by Correct the Record is just four seconds long.
The video — posted to YouTube and Twitter and sent to reporters — leaves out the context of Graham's statement: He was making the case that Republicans needed to have a full plan in response.
The latest POLITICO scoops and coverage of the 2016 elections.

description: "Hillary Clinton has a list a mile long to help the middle class,"
title: Pro-Clinton super PAC distributes clip of Graham appearing to praise Clinton
